Articles.Content: Don't think I'm doing something wrong here, but it wouldn't surprise me if it was something on my end. Getting ready to send a couple of probes to Duna for the first time in a long time and I thought I'd pop over to the Duna wiki page to get some pertinent information, only to find that the page is blank. Am I the only one getting this, or has anyone else experienced this issue with the Duna page?
Wiki is apparently hosted together with the KSP-site, and they are currently being moved to a stronger server which might or might not survive the release for more than 2 minutes.

Wiki is apparently hosted together with the KSP-site, and they are currently being moved to a stronger server which might or might not survive the release for more than 2 minutes.

LOL, I guess it didn't even occur to me that they would update their servers for the release...

LOL, I guess it didn't even occur to me that they would update their servers for the release...

I'm staring since hours at the maintenance page and it won't budge. :<
The wiki is down as well, I think they might be updating it for 1.0.

I'm staring since hours at the maintenance page and it won't budge. :<

I'm probably going to stick with 0.90 for a week or two until all of my favorite mods are updated which will also keep me away from the massive server load at release.
Seems the whole of Squad's server is down for maintenance besides the forum.

LOL, I guess it didn't even occur to me that they would update their servers for the release...

It seems that every time there's a release, there's an issue. And every time afterwards, it's "We know there's a problem, we've fixed it for next time."

I've resigned myself to not expecting to get the new release until evening the day after.
I'm glad they've at least kept the forum up, although to my complete lack of surprise I've started getting those infamous 502 errors.
